alert.note: Alert for Meade (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 28 at 7:45PM EDT until July 29 at 8:21AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM CDT/1045 PM EDT/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central Indiana and NORTH CENTRAL Kentucky, including the following counties, in south central Indiana, Perry. In NORTH CENTRAL Kentucky, Breckinridge and Meade. * WHEN...Until 945 PM CDT /1045 PM EDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 644 PM CDT /744 PM EDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Troy, Gerald, Derby, Chenaultt, Terry, Gatchel, Dexter, Lilly Dale, Manning Crossing and Mooleyville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
